subject: Photography
title: Documentary vs. Fine Art Photography
description: A quick, practical guide to Documentary vs. Fine Art Photography.

hook.text: Documentary says 'this happened.' Fine art says 'this is how it felt.' The line between them is blurrier than you think.

buildup.text: Documentary photography records events, people, and conditions with the goal of truth and witness.

discovery.text: Fine art photography prioritizes personal vision, aesthetics, and emotional expression over factual record.

twist.text: Many great photographers ‚Äî Salgado, Gold√≠n, Lange ‚Äî live in both worlds. Their work is true and beautiful.

climax.text: The boundary is philosophical, not technical. The same image can be documentary and fine art depending on context.

punchline.text: Truth and beauty aren't opposites. The best photos are both.

quiz.question: What is the primary goal of documentary photography?
options: Recording events and conditions as truthful witness
